title: LinksProcessor ID field error for native class HalCollectionWrapper
body:
### Describe the bug

Hello,

When I upgrade quarkus from 3.6.9 to 3.7.1 PR @bpasson https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/38265/files is causing the following issue.

My entity is :


    import io.quarkus.resteasy.reactive.links.RestLinkId;
    
    @Getter
    @AllArgsConstructor
    @NoArgsConstructor
    public class Car
    {
    
       @RestLinkId
       private int id;
       private int year;
       private String make;
       private String model;
    }


In my controller I have : 

      Collection<Object> objectCollection = returnCars.stream().map(car -> (Object)car).collect(Collectors.toList());
      HalCollectionWrapper halCollection = resteasyReactiveHalService.toHalCollectionWrapper(objectCollection,"result_page_"+pageRequest.getPage()+"_size_"+pageRequest.getSize(),
               Car.class);


When the app starts I get:

### Expected behavior

Since my entity is marked with `RestLinkId` and I am using quarkus's `io.quarkus.hal.HalCollectionWrapper` I should not have received `io.quarkus.resteasy.reactive.links.deployment.LinksProcessor` 's IllegalStateException. HalCollectionWrapper and HalEntityWrapper should be excluded from the Id check.

### Actual behavior

I end up getting 

    java.lang.RuntimeException: io.quarkus.builder.BuildException: Build failure: Build failed due to errors
	[error]: Build step io.quarkus.resteasy.reactive.links.deployment.LinksProcessor#initializeLinksProvider threw an exception: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Cannot generate web links for the class io.quarkus.hal.HalCollectionWrapper because it is either missing an `id` field, a field with an `@Id` annotation or a field with a `@RestLinkId annotation

### How to Reproduce?

1. Create an entity with RestLinkId annotation
2. Create a controller method like 

     `@GET`
     `@Produces({ MediaType.APPLICATION_JSON, RestMediaType.APPLICATION_HAL_JSON })`
     `@RestLink(rel = "list")`
     `@InjectRestLinks`
       public HalCollectionWrapper getCars(@BeanParam PageRequest pageRequest, @Context UriInfo uriInfo)
       {
          List<Car> returnCars = Cars.cars();
    

         Collection<Object> objectCollection = returnCars.stream().map(car -> (Object)car).collect(Collectors.toList());
      
        HalCollectionWrapper halCollection = resteasyReactiveHalService.toHalCollectionWrapper(objectCollection,"result_page_"+pageRequest.getPage()+"_size_"+pageRequest.getSize(),
         Car.class);

          halCollection.addLinks(Link.fromPath(uriInfo.getAbsolutePath().toString()+"?page="+(pageRequest.getPage()+1)+"size="+pageRequest.getSize()).rel("next_page_url").build());

          halCollection.addLinks(Link.fromPath(uriInfo.getAbsolutePath().toString()+"?page=1&size=20").rel("first_page_url").build());

         halCollection.addLinks(Link.fromPath(uriInfo.getAbsolutePath().toString()).rel("list").build());

         return halCollection;
       }
4. Run application
